THE CHALLENGE - FEBRUARY NEWSLETTER IN THIS ISSUE:
• The NCS February Programme • Applications still open • NCS adverts on the TV! • Opportunities with partner organisations
A FANTASTIC FEBRUARY PROGRAMME
2015 saw the launch of our first February NCS programme - to all the brilliant alumni staff who worked, thank you for bringing your enthusiasm, dedication and expertise!
Over 450 young people across the nation came together for a week of adventure, fun and community building. Over the next couple of weeks our young people will continue to carry out their social action projects and make their marks on their local communities. This would not be possible without the on-going support of our seasonal staff, especially those dedicating their weekends to the NCS programme!
TELL YOUR FRIENDS - APPLICATIONS ARE STILL OPEN!
We’re still looking for enthusiastic, skilled and experienced individuals to work on our exciting and intense summer 2015 programme. Help us spread the word so that your friends, family and colleagues don’t miss out - please feel free to forward this newsletter on to anyone who you think may be interested!
The 2015 application form is super easy and quick to fill out - and it even remembers information from your previous application; why wait to sign up for the summer of a lifetime? To start an application and discover which role is best for you this year, check out our Staffing Website!
NCS ADVERTS ON THE TV!
In January the NCS Trust launched a nationwide advertising campaign called ‘Our Future’, featured on billboards, online adverts and on the telly! The campaign encourages young people to speak up, get involved and make a difference by signing up for the NCS programmes.
If you haven’t seen the fantastic TV adverts yet, check out the full version here!
OPPORTUNITIES WITH OUR PARTNER ORGANISATIONS
Edustaff EduStaff is a permanent and long term education recruitment consultancy that represents teaching professionals in primary, secondary and SEN schools across the UK. Whether you are an experienced classroom practitioner, a talented NQT or currently training to become a teacher, EduStaff will help you find a school that suits your needs.
Head over to our website and upload your CV!
Premier Pathways Premier Pathways is a training programme for exceptional graduates aspiring to begin a meaningful career in education; either as a classroom teacher or psychology based specialist. With our training you will emerge from the programme with the skills and confidence required for a successful career in education. Premier Pathways is a paid, flexible opportunity to gain school based experience that is tailored towards your career aspirations.
For more information and to apply to Premier Pathways, visit our Premier Pathways website.
Talent Match Black Country Talent Match Black Country is a BIG Lottery funded project focused on reducing youth unemployment. The project works with disadvantaged 18-24 year olds who are neither employed nor in education. This voluntary programme is looking for mentors to work intensively with an individual young person, to help improve their confidence, optimism and motivation, and offers work experience, paid roles, talks and visits.
Please visit our website to find out more!
Monarch Education Monarch Education is a recruitment agency that specialises in finding permanent and temporary roles or daily supply work for leadership, teaching and support staff, including teaching or learning.
SEE YOU IN THE SUMMER! THE STAFFING TEAM
